data.title: AssetManager doesn't support assets with rounded brackets in their filename.
data.body:
If I have 2 sounds like "bg (menu).mp3" and "bg (game).mp3", AssetManager will throw an error that there is a duplicate name.

This is cause the RegExp in getName(), doesn't match on brackets.

Tofix:
matches = /(.*[\\/])?([\w\s-()]+)(.[\w]{1,4})?/.exec(name);

data.title: Async ATF loading in the AssetManager class
Better hover eventing on desktop when mouse leaves stage?
data.body:
Wondering if this could be an enhancement to the current hover eventing that happens on desktop.

Currently, when using Feathers buttons and assigning hovering skins everything works great. Feathers gets hover events and sets the hover skin and when the target changes on the hover event Feathers turns off the hovering skin on the button.

However, there is one minor case where the hovering doesn't turn off as soon as it can, leading to a slightly annoying visual effect.

If you have a Feathers button on the very edge or slightly clipped from the desktop window, then hover over the button to trigger the hover skin, _but_ move the mouse and exit the desktop Stage3D window from the button _directly_ off the edge of the window, the hover skin stays active on the button.

Starling will then not send any new 'changed target' for the hover event until the user moves the mouse back over the desktop window of the stage.
So eventually the hovered button skin fixes itself but only after the user moves the mouse back over the window.

I notice that Starling doesn't listen at all for flash.events.Event.MOUSE_LEAVE on the native stage.
http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display/Stage.html#event:mouseLeave

While it might be possible for app code or even Feathers to listen for MOUSE_LEAVE on desktop and possibly try to clean up this stale hover state, I am thinking it might only be clean if Starling's touch processing system did something on desktop with MOUSE_LEAVE to somehow send an updated hover event (with either a changed target or null target or something) that could allow listeners of hover events to recognize what should be an immediate change in the current hover state?

data.title: Juggler purge and feathers input
data.body:
I have an issue with one of my game portal (wich have 3 game).
When I leave one of the game, I try to clean them, and I use Starling.juggler.purge()
It work fine until I added to my project a feathers TextInput.
The text input is showing the first time I create one of the 3 games, but if I call Starling.juggler.purge() and try to recreate the game, the TextInput is not showing.

data.title: FragmentFilter event listener never removed
data.body: In the constructor of FragmentFilter.as a listener for Event.CONTEXT3D_CREATE is added to the stage3d of the Starling.current instance, but this event listener is never removed making it impossible to re-initialize a Starling instance (see this issue: https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/issues/140). It seems the event listener should be removed in the dispose() method of FragmentFilter.

data.title: Runtime error in Scaffold_Mobile sample
data.body:
I've just downloaded and imported the [Scaffold_Mobile sample project](https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/tree/master/samples/scaffold_mobile) into FlashDevelop.
I added 'src', 'assets', and 'system' to the build path, and I also inlcuded the starling.swc.

I can build it, but when testing it (on desktop) I get a runtime error as soon as it starts.

```
[Fault] exception, information=TypeError: Error #1009: Cannot access a property or method of a null object reference.
```

The stack trace has only 2 entries:
- AssetManager.as line:287
- Scaffold_Mobile.as:67

line 67 reads:

```
appDir.resolvePath(formatString("textures/{0}x", scaleFactor))
```

The debugger stops at  AssetManager.as line 287:

```
var extension:String = rawAsset["extension"].toLowerCase();
```

Inspecting the rawAsset object, I find that it doesn't contain an "extension" property.

What am I doing wrong?

data.title: Possible sprite scaling bug
AssetManager load atf without mipmapping
data.body:
First of all, thanks for the (already) very nice AssetManager! 

I have a little note which you might change in the code:
I just experienced an error using an atf file which didn't had mipmaps added to it. Eventually this was caused by the "fromAtfData" method which was not passing the mGenerateMipmaps boolean for disabling mipmaps. You might change it in the original code so nobody else will experience it. 

Thanks again for all the good work!

data.title: Movieclip.fps setting performance issue
Separate Touch processing from dispatching
data.body:
Hey Daniel, here's the pull request with my minor refactor of TouchProcessor. This essentially breaks TouchProcessor into two different classes: TouchProcessor, which creates Touch objects, and TouchDispatcher, which implements a new TouchHandler interface and does the TouchEvent creation and dispatching.

Starling's default behavior and API are unchanged. There's a new property on the Starling class, 'touchHandler', which allows user code to install its own TouchHandler object and perform custom Touch input processing.

I've tested this code against the Starling demos and unit tests.

data.title: Adding .pex support for AssetManager class
MultiTouch simulation bug
data.body:
Hi, fair reproducibility on newest .swc file:
1. Mouse Down on touchable area -> Touch with phase BEGAN id 0
2. Ctrl key down -> Touch with phase BEGAN id 1
3. Ctrl key up -> Touch with phase ENDED id 1
4. Ctrl key down -> Nothing
5. Ctrl key up -> Touch with phase ENDED id 1
   ...

Step 4. is in my opinion buggy as there should happen the same as in step no 2

Cheers

data.title: Loader in AssetManager, version 1.3 RC
data.body:
![Standard-build-iOS](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3121125/30626/42ca6f66-4edb-11e2-9ae3-6c55f6e8a58e.JPG)
Hello,
I'm testing the new AssetManager in version 1.3 RC, incorporated samples / demo.

And I have some questions, I see that uses methods such as:

"Loader.loadBytes" and "Loader". If I remember correctly, are not allowed on iOS.

Not allowed external load in iOS app.

Up to Air version 3.5.

In the new version, Air 3.6 beta, it has incorporated a new feature,

"Multiple SWF support"

http://labsdownload.adobe.com/pub/labs/flashruntimes/shared/air3-6_flashplayer11-6_releasenotes.pdf

but even so, still not permitted methods, Methods unload () and loadBytes ().

You use the "Loader.loadBytes" in AssetManager in line 478.

When launch on device, in Fast mode, works well, (I guess that is a virtual air).

But when launch on device, in Standard mode, this hour in 57% progress, and never ends. It does not show error, but I guess it is because they are not allowed to use these methods?

Something similar here (reply 18):
http://forums.adobe.com/message/4925884

I use the FB 4.7 and Air 3.5 and sample mobile:

https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/tree/master/samples/demo

The other demos I have in FB 4.7, work well.

Thanks for listening.

data.title: Scissor rectangles have a width/height of zero when using a shared context3D
data.body:
Hi, I had this issue using a shared context3D with Starling and some Feathers components that use masks to clip the content, like the PickerList and Toggle button.

Starling doesn't call mSupport.configureBackBuffer from updateViewPort when using a shared context. That means mRenderTargetWidth and mRenderTargetHeight don't get set in the RenderSupport, and any rectangle passed to set scissorRectangle has it's width and height multiplied by zero...

I tested commenting out the shared context check in Starling.updateViewPort, so configureBackBuffer is always called, and that solved the problem. It might be better if it were configurable though.

Here's the test project/commit: https://github.com/mikedotalmond/feathers-shared-context3D/commit/6ae7edad84996d3fbea35167ddcc4225b742e028

data.title: Text field auto size
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

This adds auto-sizing capabilities to TextField. I broke the pull request into two commits - the first, "trim trailing whitespace", just removes trailing whitespace from the affected files (my editor does this automatically, and I didn't want the whitespace changes to be mixed in with the actual patch and make everything hard to read).

The commit notes should be self-explanatory, I hope.

This is intended to address the https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/issues/169 open issue

data.title: MovieClip problem
Consider making TouchProcessor & friends extensible?
data.body:
Starling is very rigid in its approach to touch processing - if you want to use starling TouchEvents at all, you _have_ to go through the display list - there's no way that I can see to intercept events before they get dispatched on the display list (short of reimplementing all the touch processing plumbing and bypassing Starling completely).

Would you consider adding more extensibility to the touch processing design? Making TouchProcessor more easily subclassable would be a big step towards easier extensibility. A more ambitious design might involve a touch processing interface that TouchProcessor implements but that other external classes could implement as well in order to have a first chance at processing touch events.

(I've found that, for games that reach a certain complexity, having fine-grained control over input processing is the best way to contain what can otherwise become brittle, chaotic code.)

If you have any interest, I'd be happy to submit a pull request that implements either of these approaches. It'd almost certainly involve making some of the starling_internal components of the touch architecture public (like the ability to dispatch a TouchEvent on a bubble chain).

data.title: Texture.optimizeForRenderTexture -> optimizeForRenderToTexture
data.body: Just a spelling change. "optimizeForRenderTexture" makes it sound like there's an optimization that will render textures more quickly - and why wouldn't you want that turned on! But "optimizeForRenderToTexture" (the Flash wording) makes it more clear that this optimization has to do with using the texture as a rendering target.

data.title: getting Starling to handle scale and align modes
data.body:
I have extra work-around code, and have patched Starling.as, to allow it to work with the various Flash scale modes, because noscale and topleft are rarely what I need to do! Could you read my explanation about the issues, and my work around code, here:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/about-stage-scale-and-align

If you can follow what I say there, would it be possible for you to either completely fix this aspect of Starling, or perhaps add touch event scaling parameters so that I don't have to hack your files when there is an update?

Thanks.

data.title: Rectangle.Util not found
data.body:
I am trying the latest version of Feathers and Starling and it doesn't seem to work.

Feathers requires RectangleUtil class which doesn't seem to appear in starling.swc, although it exists in the starling sources.

Error - 

The definition starling.utils.RectangleUtil depended on by feathers.controls.ImageLoader could not be found 

Would appreciate any help.

-romil

data.title: Fix Demo source paths in Flex Builder
data.body:
This fixes the Flash Builder demo projects, which currently refer to source paths on another developer's machine ("/Users/redge/Development/starling"). I changed the paths so that they're relative to an Eclipse workspace path variable (STARLING_FRAMEWORK).

If this change is accepted, users will have to add this path variable to Flash Builder (Preferences > General > Workspace > Linked Resources. Add a new path variable called STARLING_FRAMEWORK that points to the root Starling-Framework directory).

data.title: Flasbuilder 4.7 / ASC 2 / Inline Functions: Not working with Starling?
data.body:
Tried to use the inlining feature of the new compiler but even in a blank Starling/feathers project I always get the following compiler error:

VerifyError: Error #1030: Stack depth is unbalanced. 0 != 1.

```
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/invokeEvent()[C:\REMOVED\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:138]
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEvent()[C:\REMOVED\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:109]
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEventWith()[C:\REMOVED\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:187]
```

Am I doing something wrong (only added -inline to the compiler options) or is Starling not yet compatible with this feature?

data.title: Feature - tilemaps
data.body: I remember this was on roadmap in june or so. Is it going to be worked on or are there any solutions to this problem ?

data.title: Native overlay content not rendering when Starling stopped
data.body:
This older thread:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/starlingstop-seems-to-stop-flash-completely

seemed to suggest that you intended for native display list content in the native overlay to continue to run and update even if Starling was stopped?

The latest sources of Starling seems to have reverted to only calling any render methods as long as Starling was started.
Is this an intended new requirement and change?
